group_1.textCenter: Oh, look at the time. Guess I'd better go.

group_1.textLeft: N-now you just wait a moment, Yozuru!
You've got cram school today! What're you@carrying that for?

group_1.textRight: Look, you signed me up for cram school without@asking me.
I don't plan on going there. I've never ever@wanted to go.

group_1.textLeft: I'm... I'm your mother!!@I'm doing all of this for your future!

group_1.textRight: Yeah, and you're hurting me in the process.@Why can't you see that?!
You're just trying to turn me into your@property, aren't you?

group_1.narration: I had my freedom from my mother's grasp.
Surely ceasing to be the ideal child she envisioned.
Ceasing to be the obedient, darling little girl on rails.@Heading towards my mother's vision of a bright future.

group_1.textCenter: What was my mistake...?@Where did I go wrong...?

group_1.narration: Eventually my mother would mutter@such things to herself almost every day.
Only now do I understand:@These weren't criticisms of me.
But lamentations for the future that I,@who strayed from the rails of her vision,@would never see.
But shackles were her only method...
And I understood it well.@Fearing a return to being under her thumb.@Despite having the means to resist.
She had been walking, gazing at the skies above,@when a distracted trucker ran her over.
That said, it was an unobstructed road.
The driver or the pedestrian --@Had either one noticed the other,@Such an accident should never@have happened, they said.
I had finally obtained my freedom...@But strangely, when I thought about it,@I couldn't help but cry.
